name: MistralAIModel

input.content:
I have a webpage that's open in a chrome browser but the page no longer exists. 
What javascript should I type in the console to get a copy of the entire page html?

output:
You can use the following JavaScript code in the Chrome Developer Console to get a copy of the entire page HTML:

```javascript
let html = document.documentElement.outerHTML;
console.log(html);
```

This code will store the entire HTML of the page in the `html` variable and then log it to the console. You can then copy the HTML from the console.

However, please note that if the page no longer exists on the server, this method won't work as the HTML is not available anymore. This method only works for the currently loaded HTML in your browser.

If the page is gone and you didn't save a copy of it, you might be out of luck unless you have a caching extension installed or if Google (or another search engine) has a cached version of the page.

name: WordEvaluator
input:
You can use the following JavaScript code in the Chrome Developer Console to get a copy of the entire page HTML:

```javascript
let html = document.documentElement.outerHTML;
console.log(html);
```

This code will store the entire HTML of the page in the `html` variable and then log it to the console. You can then copy the HTML from the console.

However, please note that if the page no longer exists on the server, this method won't work as the HTML is not available anymore. This method only works for the currently loaded HTML in your browser.

If the page is gone and you didn't save a copy of it, you might be out of luck unless you have a caching extension installed or if Google (or another search engine) has a cached version of the page.
